data.profileText: A Representative from South Carolina; born in Williamsburg District, S.C., October 17, 1778; graduated from Rhode Island College (now Brown University), Providence, R.I., in 1797; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1800 and commenced practice in Peedee, S.C.; member of the South Carolina state house of representatives, 1800-1804; solicitor of the northern judicial circuit, 1804-1816; trustee of South Carolina College, 1809-1817; again a member of the South Carolina state house of representatives in 1810 and 1811; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Fifteenth Congress and reelected to the Sixteenth Congress (March 4, 1817-March 3, 1821); declined to be a candidate for renomination in 1820; engaged in agricultural pursuits; member of the South Carolina state senate 1826-1829; served as a delegate to the South Carolina state convention in 1832; died in Darlington, S.C., c. September 29, 1838; interment at his home.
